Reviews.Title: “Very poor booking policy, beware”
Reviews.Author: Valerie L
Reviews.Content: My daughter booked at this hotel on July 16, 2011, giving them her credit card details. By email, they replied: â€œWe have some problem with your credit card, it seems not correct or maybe is an electronic card. Anyway we are not able to get the authorisation to confirm the booking. Could you please send us as soon as possible a new credit card details? Visa or Mastercard please. Otherwise we will cancel the booking in Venere.comâ€� My daughter did not have another credit card and so was unable to send details of another card. As the hotel said it would cancel the booking if no other card was received, she took the hotelâ€™s word as the truth â€“ that they would cancel the booking. She made other arrangements for her stay in Venice. She was shocked to find that on 18 July 2011 the emailed her to tell her that â€œtoday the card is good!!â€� Despite advising her that the hotel would cancel the booking if no other card details were supplied, and despite not receiving any other credit card, the hotel continued to try to process the original card. Clearly, the hotel was at fault on two counts: 1. The hotel broke its word by saying the booking would be cancelled if no further card detail was provided. 2. There was nothing wrong with the card in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: p17q
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else mentioned, this is a very convenient location, it was just 5 minutes away from St.Mark's Square..and 5 minutes away from the vaporette stop (that is if you find it right away the first time). It did take me a good 15 minutes to finally locate the handwritten sign pointing towards the tiny alleyway into the 'hotel'. But once you know where it is, it's a great location. I just wish their entrance was located out of the alley way because that alley was pretty gross. Always had like fruit flies or some sort of flies flying around..but once you're inside, the place is really clean. The staff were great and helpful. I was in a single room, it was spacious enough for me and was pretty clean. Had my own bathroom, the only thing was they only give you first 30minutes of free wifi, after that, you'd have to pay. If you're just looking for a convenient location to stay in venice with your own bathroom and stuff, then this isn't bad. I still think maybe there are better deals with the price I paid for..but it is venice after all!

Reviews.Title: “Would not go there again!”
Reviews.Author: ebbe1983
Reviews.Content: Location: 3 mins of walking to St.Marco's square. Not bad at all. Short way to Vaporetto stops. But....how to find the hotel? The only thing that we could see after wandering around for a while, was a SMALL sign (handwritten) on the wall, saying the name of the hotel and an arrow pointing into the alley. Rooms: Yellow walls, which were kind of dirty and smuttered with something. We also made a big contribution to that, since we killed like 50 mosquitos during our stay. Blood all over:(:( TV - did not work at all. Breakfast - made me sick, and it was cheese and some salami, juice and that was about it. Price!!! Dont make me go there. TOO pricy even though the great location. 780 EUROS for 4 nights. Not worth it at all. Maybe not that much during lower seasons, but anyway. So, I would not recommend it. Being sick from the food and having to spray our room with bug-spray twice a day and my boyfriend me bitten approx 20 times, and they do not look good, even a week after he got them!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ASTRA5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Tiepolo for 4 nights, its in a great location, about 5 mins from St Marks square and about 5 mins from San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. First the positives about the hotel, its very clean, rooms are cleaned daily, there is a safe in the room, the staff were helpful any time we needed help. Now the negatives, the room is small not much space for clothes, the hairdryer worked but the hose was broken and all the air went through the broken hose, the mini fridge didn't work. The breakfast was ok but very basic, tinned fruit, rolls,cheese, cornflakes, juices. As all the hotels in Venice are expensive this one was the best value and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: catcat42
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this hotel, it was right in the center of venice, on a canal side, the room was very spacy, very clean, very nice with murrano lusters, very nice bathroom, the staff was ok, the breakfast really nice in a beautiful room with a view on the canal! really great, and cheap for the location, will return there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalCathy
Reviews.Content: Good value: central location in San Marco, very clean, quiet. Sheets were nice, room and bath did not have any musty or moldy smell - remodeled room an bath was nice. Room was small, but ample for 1 person. Breakfast was good and staff was nice. Cons: towels are like bedsheets, TV is small, no waiting area in lobby, no clock in room, but these are very minor cons. It was a bit hard to find, as it is down a narrow passage and around the corner, so it is not visible from the main street.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zimo_Vienna
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Venice very much, Hotel Tiepolo contributed to this to a large extent. The room was spacious with nice furniture and good beds, very nice atmosphere. The bathroom was furnished very nicely with mosaic tiles and a very modern shower. Breakfast offered a wide range of stuff and was replenished regularly. Only when our neighbour was on the telephone we could hear every word. We would definitely recommend this Hotel to our friends. If you don't have the map from the website you might have difficulties to find the entrance. But with the description it should be easy.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Garnet_Stone
Reviews.Content: What a lovely boutique style hotel. I booked a single room for 1 night directly from Hotel Tiepoloâ€™s website â€“ the rate was 50 euros. The room was spacious for a single, spotless with a clean minimalist decor and high wood beamed ceilings. The bathroom was oversized, well stocked and had a relaxing spa shower. The staff was very accommodating and always upbeat. Reception was available 24/7. The location of the hotel was absolutely perfect. Less than 5 minute walk from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop and even closer to Piazza San Marco. Walked back to the hotel after midnight â€“ area (and Venice as a whole) is very safe! Highly recommend, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: faijason
Reviews.Content: Terrible corridor to the entrance, got scared off, but once you steps in, everything is trendy. Superb convenience location, few mins walk from St. Marco square, nothing can beat that. Somehow the bathroom towel is very rough, I thought they are table cloths. Minor smell from the river (our room can see the small canal with gondolas around, which is very cool) The room is clean overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: simes
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family of 5 and booked one double, one twin and one single room. The hotel is approached from the darkest narrowest alley i have ever seen and it is a bit soul destroying to be honest. However when we opened the door we were met by a lovely receptionist who showed us to two of our rooms and allowed us to check in although we were very early. The hotel is boutique style, very minimal, the rooms are basic, with modern bathrooms which are exceptionally clean having excellent fittings and the normal complimentary shampoo, soap etc. Towels changed daily are the thin cotton type no fluffy ones. Sheets very white and looked new, no english channels on the t.v. The breakfast room was a corridor outside one of our family members room. Breakfast is the normal continental, perfectly adequate and you could watch the gondaliers rowing past. The hotel has a sister hotel across the square and you are given a voucher for the restaurant outside which is also attached to both hotels. There are no tea or coffee making facilities and nothing else offered or available which is a shame as they have a coffee machine in reception. The best restaurant we found is out of hotel, turn left, and left again continue over the bridge, it can be found on the right hand side and looks as if it is outside with a canopy, which it is!!, best in the area by far. My tip would be enjoy the tourist menus which include tax AND service charges you will get stung for the 2 charges if you eat off the normal menu. The best thing about this hotel is the location you are barely 5 minutes from water taxi stop, and 5 minutes from St Marks Sq, with all its attractions.

Reviews.Title: “expensive and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: florencehippo
Reviews.Content: Minibar fridge did not work, the light was on but everything inside it was warm. Hairdryer did not work either and when repaired, had only the blowing strength of an asthmatic butterfly. Air con was freezing. No lid on the waste bin in the bathroom Staff usually on duty at their other hotel, next door, so no 24 hour reception. Price was horrendous for a three star.....240 Euros per night!! The canal view is more brick wall than canal. Worst of all.....a member of reception staff unlocked the door in the late afternoon and walked in on us when we were in the middle of showering, getting ready to go out again. Quite embarrassing when you are in the buff.! No excuse for this, because there is an electronic key system in use which illuminates a red light outside the door when the room isoccupied, so that was rather upsetting. The manageress of the hotel was not at all apologetic for this and made usfeel as though it was OUR fault for being in our room! We definitely would not stay there again at the price. I feel quite ripped off. This is my 3rd time in Venice and there are many better hotels in which to stay where you will get better value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BingleyMatty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November. Upon finding the hotel down a small alleyway off the main square we were welcomed and shown to our lovely room 104. The room was spacious with an open beamed ceiling, modern furnishings and a canal view from both windows. Te bathroom was mosaic tiled in blue and white with a power shower, wc, bidet and sink. The hotel was spotless and had obviously been fitted out fairly recently. Breakfast was lovely with a wide selection including salami, cheeses, toast, bread, cake, fruit salad and cereals. Good coffee served by very friendly staff who I managed to communicate with despite knowing next to no italian! The hotel was fantastic and the only slight moan was our room was very cold as the heating was not working iin our room. They did supply us with two small heaters which did warm things up. The rest of the hotel seemed warm enough. The towels in the rooms are not soft and fluffy, but very fine white cotton, almost like an english tablecloth! They were very clean and soft but we much preferred the english style of towel for comfort, especially when in a cold room! The Hotel is centrally located and is a 5 minute stroll to St Marks' square or 10 minutes to Rialto. I cannot remember the name of our favourite restaurant, but if you go out of the hotel and turn left, then left again and after 15m you will come to a little bridge crossing the canal that runs behind the restaurant. At the side of the bridge on the right hand side is a small tratoria noset back. It was beautiful food, the cuttlefish in black sauce is a winner. Make sure you take trip to the markets near Rialto. Another good restaurant is DiMarco, in the San Polo area. For fantastic pizza visit Bora Bora, which is up a small alley way opposite the street that takes you onto the Rialto Bridge. Great house wine too. We had a fantastic time in Venice and would definitely return to this hotel. I booked direct with the hotel's website and paid â‚¬80 per room per night. Make sure you take your confirmation as we experienced a small misunderstanding and the hotel wanted to charge us a higher room rate - this was resolved when they checked the paperwork with problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable accomodation”
Reviews.Author: jessfess
Reviews.Content: I totally concur with the fellow Swiss reviewer - the Tiepolo is not the best hotel (access to main door, shower with a missing door panel) but for the price, it is very good value. We stayed at the Tiepolo after Xmas so it was off-peak â€“ we got a canal room for 70 euros a night which is very cheap for Venice. The rooms are basic but clean and simple (unlike a lot of Italian hotels). Plus there are rooms right next to a canal where gondolas go by and the location is fantastic - right near St Mark's Square. I would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location + Good Value = Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2BAnonymous
Reviews.Content: For the traveler with a bit of flexibility, the Tiepolo is an ideal place to stay. It is clean, modern and the location is fantastic. Oh, and it was an amazing value (EUR 70 per night, including taxes, fees and a breakfast for two). But in order to achieve the value a place like the Tiepolo offers, you have to be willing to sacrifice a few things. Service would be one... There was no one staffing the desk at the hotel - each time you wanted to get in the front door, you had to go to the neighboring hotel to have someone walk over and unlock the door. Although this was a little tedious, it did not dampen our stay. (Admittedly, we were at the hotel during a period of low occupancy so it might differ during high season.) The location is great. The hotel is just off a small square about a five minute walk from the San Zaccaria vaporetto (the "water bus") stop and a little less from Piazza San Marco. The entrance is a little hard to find the first time, but the map provided by the hotel with our reservation confirmation lead us right to the door. I would recommend printing it out and keeping it handy for your arrival. The hotel is new, so the finishings are pristine. Stylistically, it is a nice blend of simple, modern design and the classic features of the building. It is a perfect haven for those who shudder at the thought of spending the night in a room overwhelmed by Venetian styling (faux frescos, gold-painted bed posts and draping fabrics - yuck!). Our room (no. 109) was small, but functional. It offered all of the required amenities, including an in-room safe and a small refrigerator. (For those needing Internet access, there is an Internet cafÃ© just around the corner from the hotel.) Surprisingly, the bathroom was large enough to support a bidet and full-sized bathtub without feeling cramped. The view from our room was not too exciting as it consisted of the building next door - only about three meters away. Breakfast is served in a long, narrow room. It is a bit like eating in a galley (or a subway car as the person sitting next to us remarked), but is perfectly manageable. There is a large, glass door at the end of the room that provides a view onto a small, side canal. The fare is pretty standard for a three-star hotel - fresh breads, sausage and cheeses, cereal and yogurts. Nothing exceptional, but perfectly acceptable. The Tiepolo has several related restaurants nearby. They offer a 10% discount off the total meal (alcohol included), which almost completely offsets the standard "service fee" charged by Venetian restaurants for occupying a table. We ate at Aciugheta our first night and were pleased. The food was reasonably priced and of good quality, although we did have a bit of trouble finding a wine on their list that they actually had available. The Tiepolo is not perfect, but it is a fantastic value. If I had paid the posted rack rate of our room (EUR 250), I might have felt ripped off. But at only EUR 70 a night, I instead felt like I got more than my money's worth and was pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Che bell'Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Io ed un mio amico siamo stati deliziati da questa permanenza in terra veneziana...lo suggerisco davvero a chi vuole risiedere a due passsi da Piazza San Marco e goddere la tranquillitÃ  delle callette strette di Venezia. L'albergo, oltre ad essere nuovo e curato nei minimi dettagli, ha il vantaggio di essere collegato ai due ristoranti di Campo S. FIlilippo e Giacomo: sono, infatti dello stesso proprietario. Ho prenotato dal sito dell'albergo, ha proprio delle offerte interessanti e sono celeri nelle risposte, provate a cercarlo come "hoteltiepolo".

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Clean - Good location”
Reviews.Author: Sunpoppy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a charming respite from the bustling venetian streets and alleys. The location of the hotel is slightly difficult to find as it is off of a small piazza and down a short alley. However, it is a quiet hotel with charming rooms, high ceilings and attrative decor. Our room was a triple and had plenty of space. The bathroom was large by european standards with a spa shower that was wonderful at the end of a long day of walking the cobblestone streets. The breakfast room is narrow, with a door at the end that leads to the canal. Very cute, although very small. Breakfast was typical italian style, crusty bread, cheeses, yogurt, salami with also a selection of cold cereals. Staff was attentive but not overbearing. We indicated that we had an early morning flight and upon checkout the front desk clerk had packed us a bag of goodies to have for breakfast as our departure was prior to the hotels kitchen opening. Would recommend for location, was only a short walk from Piazza San Marco and close to some residential neighborhood streets with charming shopping and restaurants.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Tiepolo
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 4510, 30122 Venice, Italy
